title: Ethiopian Coffee Ceremony
content: Coffee is central to Ethiopian culture. The traditional ceremony involves roasting beans, grinding, and brewing in a special pot called a 'jebena'. Accept three servings if offered!

title: Ethiopian Cuisine
content: Try Injera (sourdough flatbread) with Doro Wat (chicken stew) or Kitfo (minced raw meat). Vegetarians will love the variety of lentil and vegetable dishes.

title: Cultural Etiquette
content: Remove shoes when entering churches and homes. Use your right hand for eating and greeting. Dress modestly, especially in religious sites.

title: Best Time to Visit
content: Oct-May is the dry season and best for travel. The rainy season (Jun-Sep) brings lush landscapes but can make roads difficult.

title: Currency & Money
content: Ethiopian Birr (ETB) is the currency. ATMs available in major cities. Carry cash for rural areas. USD and EUR can be exchanged at banks.
